channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Is car parking allowed?, 27th September
item.description:
On Badger Close, there are 4 cars parked on what appears to be a pavement. Is this allowed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Punningar Close, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is raised, 27th September
item.description:
The drain is raised to a point where somebody is going to trip on it as I have just done. A lot of elderly live around here and so is very concerning as it is protruding out of the ground at on end
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinemount Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Broken glass on children's play equipment, 27th September
item.description:
Second instance in recent weeks of broken glass bottles on children's play equipment in Queen Elizabeth 2 park. Anti-social behaviour is clearly not being taken seriously. Discarded clothes and drug paraphernalia also littering the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saxon Way, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Quantity recycling ‚ôªÔ∏è Materials Dumped, 27th September
item.description:
Resident asks: Could we have more recycling bins to prevent this happening every two weeks with cardboard being blown around the car park and into Cowl Lane ? If this is business waste, please investigate, if this is residential waste, please provide residents with more recycling ‚ôªÔ∏è bin capacity. Thank you.üôè

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowl Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
